cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 510 miles SE of New Orleans, Louisiana and 185 miles WNW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the east-central Gulf of Mexico and aiming for a landfall along the southeast Louisiana coast, then inland through Louisiana and western Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana (near the Mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch is posted from the Mississippi/Alabama border eastward to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River, including Metropolitan New Orleans; Tropical-storm and Storm-Surge Warnings along much of the Louisiana–Mississippi coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern U.S. Gulf Coast from southeast Texas to the western Florida Panhandle, with greatest impacts expected in southeast Louisiana and coastal Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands may bring occasional gusts 20–30 mph; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (<4% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the lower Tampa Bay shoreline, mainly during high-tide cycles.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered heavy showers could total 1–3 inches as outer bands brush the west-central Florida coast late Saturday into Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and higher surf along the west-central Florida beaches through the weekend.
